00039 /**
00040  * CallElement::CallElement()
00041  * Synopsis:
00042  *
00043  * Empty constructor for STL storage containers or for
00044  * translation file call elements.
00045  *
00046  * NOTE: base is used interchangabley to mean allele. In DMET 2
00047  * alleles where always represented as just one base.
00048  *
00049  *
00050  */
00051 /*****************************************************************************/
00052 CallElement::CallElement() :  m_chromatid(0), m_probeSet("")
00053 {
00054   m_hasWildCards         = false;
00055   m_hasReverseComplement = false;
00056   m_completeSetSize      = -1;
00057   
00058 }
00059 // end CallElement::CallElement
00060 /*****************************************************************************/
00061 
00062 /*****************************************************************************/
00063 /**
00064  * CallElement::CallElement()
00065  * Synopsis:
00066  * GenotypeTableModel (CHP) version of the CallElement constructor.
00067  *
00068  * This is not obvious but when a CallElement is created for
00069  * the GenotypeTableModel, it will always have exactly one base.
00070  * Multiple bases only apply to mult-allelic defintions in the
00071  * Translation table.
00072  *
00073  * NOTE: base is used interchangabley to mean allele. In DMET two
00074  * alleles where always represented as just one base.
00075  *
00076  * @param probeSet    - aka "marker", ie.e AM_14633, etc.
00077  * @param base        - aka "alleles", A, or ATATGGA. For multiallelic
00078  *                      markers intialize with one base and then
00079  *                      append markers using CallElement::addBase().
00080  * @param copyNumber  - 2 by default. 0 and 1 are the only other legal values.
00081  * @param hasRevComp  - reverse complement, if the "Switch" field in translation
00082  *                      file or annotation file is "Y/1" then the reverse
00083  *                      compliment of the base will be used durring translation.
00084  *                      See "CallElement::reverseComplement".
00085  *
00086  */
00087 /*****************************************************************************/
00088 CallElement::CallElement(const std::string & probeSet,  const std::string & base, const unsigned int copyNumber, const bool hasRevComp):    m_chromatid(0), m_copyNumber( copyNumber),  m_hasReverseComplement(hasRevComp),   m_probeSet(probeSet)
00089 {
00090 
00091   m_completeSetSize      = -1;
00092 
00093   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_copyNumber <= 2, "Invalid parameters to CallElement constructor");
00094 
00095   if (! isValidProbeSet(probeSet)) {
00096     APT_ERR_ABORT(probeSet + ": Invalid probeSet not recognized by translation file");
00097   }
00098 
00099   if (! isValidBase(base)) {
00100     APT_ERR_ABORT(probeSet + ": Base ("  + base + ") not recognized by translation file.");
00101   }
00102 
00103   addBase(base);
00104 
00105   m_hasWildCards = isWildCardBase(base);
00106 
00107 }
00108 // end CallElement::CallElement
00109 /*****************************************************************************/
00110 /*****************************************************************************/
00111 /**
00112  * CallElement::addBase
00113  * Synopsis:
00114  *
00115  * Append a base (allele) to the std::vector of bases (alleles). Insure the
00116  * added base is not a duplicate as well that the base is valid.
00117  * Also adds the passed in base to its reverse complement list if the
00118  * element the 'hasReverseComplement' attribute is true;
00119  *
00120  * @param base - the base to add.
00121  * @return true - if base was added successfully.
00122  *
00123  */
00124 /*****************************************************************************/
00125 bool CallElement::addBase(const std::string & base)
00126 {
00127 
00128   if (!isValidBase(base)) {
00129     return false;
00130   }
00131 
00132   for (int i = 0 ; i < m_bases.size(); i++) {
00133     if (m_bases[i] == base) {
00134       return false;
00135     }
00136   }
00137 
00138   m_bases.push_back(base);
00139 
00140   if (m_hasReverseComplement) {
00141     m_rbases.push_back(reverseComplement(base));
00142   }
00143 
00144   return true;
00145 
00146 }
00147 // end CallElement::addBase
00148 /*****************************************************************************/
00149 /*****************************************************************************/
00150 /**
00151  * CallElement::basesToString
00152  * Synopsis:
00153  *
00154  * Return a list of the bases (alleles) for this CallElement as a
00155  * comma separated list. For most bi-allelic markers in the translation
00156  * table the list size will be one.
00157  *
00158  * @param reverseComplement - return the list of reverse complements and not
00159  * the original bases (alleles).
00160  *
00161  * @returns basesString - i.e. "A,T,G".
00162  *
00163  */
00164 /*****************************************************************************/
00165 std::string CallElement::basesToString(bool reverseComplement) const
00166 {
00167 
00168   std::string basesString;
00169 
00170   if (reverseComplement) {
00171     for (int i = 0; i < m_rbases.size(); i++) {
00172       if (i == 0) {
00173         basesString = m_rbases[0];
00174       } else {
00175         basesString = basesString + "," + m_rbases[i];
00176       }
00177     }
00178 
00179   } else {
00180     for (int i = 0; i < m_bases.size(); i++) {
00181       if (i == 0) {
00182         basesString = m_bases[0];
00183       } else {
00184         basesString = basesString + "," + m_bases[i];
00185       }
00186     }
00187   }
00188 
00189   return basesString;
00190 
00191 }
00192 // end basesToString
00193 /*****************************************************************************/
00194 /*****************************************************************************/
00195 /**
00196  * CallElement::setCompleteSetSize
00197  * Synopsis:
00198  *
00199  * A CallElement typically represents one marker, but in one special
00200  * case the complete call element set represents all alleles (bases)
00201  * possible for a marker. This API is used in that one special
00202  * case to get the complete set size. The complete set size
00203  * is used in the translation algorithm.
00204  * 
00205  * Complete set size, n: 1 The count of all allels (bases) minus any copy
00206  * number bases. 
00207  *
00208  * return size - the count
00209  *
00210  */
00211 /*****************************************************************************/
00212 int CallElement::setCompleteSetSize() {
00213 
00214 
00215   m_completeSetSize = 0;
00216   
00217   for ( int i = 0; i < m_bases.size(); i++ ) {
00218     if (m_bases[i] != "0") {
00219       m_completeSetSize++;
00220     }
00221   }
00222 
00223   return m_completeSetSize;
00224   
00225 }
00226 // end CallElement::setCompleteSetSize()

00229 /**
00230  * CallElement::describeVerbose
00231  * Synopsis:
00232  *
00233  * Run time debug routine that can be invoked with various verbose levels.
00234  * ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES is the default level.
00235  *
00236  * @param rte       - run time environment
00237  * @param override  - ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES by default,
00238  *                    otherwise the ADT_VERBOSE_ENUM level to output
00239  *
00240  */
00241 /*****************************************************************************/
00242 void CallElement::describeVerbose(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte,
00243                                   ADT_VERBOSE_ENUM override) const
00244 {
00245 
00246   if (!override && (rte.m_currentVerbosity < ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES))
00247     return;
00248 
00249   if (override) {
00250     describeVerbose(override);
00251   } else {
00252     describeVerbose(ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES);
00253   }
00254 
00255   return;
00256 
00257 }
00258 /*****************************************************************************/
00259 void CallElement::describeVerbose(ADT_VERBOSE_ENUM level) const
00260 {
00261 
00262 
00263   std::stringstream msgSStr;
00264 
00265   msgSStr << "CallElement::describeVerbose (probeSet : bases): (";
00266   msgSStr << m_probeSet << ":" << basesToString();
00267 
00268   if (m_hasReverseComplement) {
00269     msgSStr << " [ reverse complement bases : ";
00270     msgSStr << basesToString(true) << " ]";
00271   }
00272 
00273   msgSStr << ")";
00274 
00275   Verbose::out(level, msgSStr.str());
00276 
00277   return;
00278 
00279 }
00280 // end CallElement::describeVerbose

00283 /**
00284  * CallElement::isValidProbeSet
00285  * Synopsis:
00286  *
00287  * Regular expression test to examine if a probe set (marker) std::string is
00288  * valid.
00289  *
00290  *
00291  * @param testProbeSet - the std::string to validate
00292  *
00293  * @return true - if valid
00294  */
00295 /*****************************************************************************/
00296 bool CallElement::isValidProbeSet(const std::string & testProbeSet)
00297 {
00298 
00299   pcrecpp::RE re("^[_\\-\\w\\d]*\\d+$");
00300 
00301   return re.FullMatch(testProbeSet);
00302 
00303 }
00304 // end CallElement::isValidProbeSet
00305 /*****************************************************************************/
00306 /*****************************************************************************/
00307 /**
00308  * CallElement::isValidBase
00309  * Synopsis:
00310  *
00311  * Regular expression test to examine if a base (allele) is valid.
00312  * Wildcard designations such as "PossibleRareAllele" and "NoCall"
00313  * are handled correctly and will return true.
00314  *
00315  *
00316  * @param testBase - the base (allele) std::string to validate.
00317  *
00318  * @return - true if valid
00319  *
00320  */
00321 /*****************************************************************************/
00322 bool CallElement::isValidBase(const std::string & testBase)
00323 {
00324 
00325 
00326   pcrecpp::RE re("[ACTG0]+|-|INS|DEL|Ins|Del");
00327 
00328   return (isWildCardBase(testBase) || re.FullMatch(testBase));
00329 
00330 }
00331 // end CallElement::isValidBase
00332 /*****************************************************************************/
00333 /*****************************************************************************/
00334 /**
00335  * CallElement::isWildCardBase
00336  * Synopsis:
00337  *
00338  * Regular exxpression test to examine if a base (allele) is a wild card.
00339  *
00340  * Wildcard list:
00341  * 1.) NoCall (NC)
00342  * 2.) PossibleRareAllele (PRA)
00343  * 3.) NotAvailable
00344  *
00345  *
00346  * @param base - the base (allele) to test.
00347  *
00348  * @return true - if the base (allele) is a wild card.
00349  *
00350  */
00351 /*****************************************************************************/
00352 bool CallElement::isWildCardBase(std::string base)
00353 {
00354 
00355 
00356   if (pcrecpp::RE("NC|NoCall|PRA|PossibleRareAllele|NotAvailable").FullMatch(base)) {
00357     return(true);
00358   }
00359 
00360   return false;
00361 
00362 }
00363 // end CallElement::isWildCardBase
00364 /*****************************************************************************/
00365 /*****************************************************************************/
00366 /**
00367  * CallElement::operator==
00368  * Synopsis:
00369  *
00370  * The purpose of the CallElement class is to provide this one operator.
00371  *
00372  * This operator treats the probe set (marker) id and a corresponding
00373  * list of bases (alleles) as an atomic unit.
00374  *
00375  * Comparing call elements as equivalent means the atomic consituents
00376  * must also be equivalent according to a set of rules. 
00377  *
00378  * Business rules treat no call and  possible rare
00379  * allele as wildcards that match any base. It also compares
00380  * multi-allelic CallElements and if they share a common base then
00381  * they are equal. Note that for CallElements derived from
00382  * the Genotype Short Report data they can never be multi-allelic.
00383  * This means that the only multi-allelic CallElement being
00384  * compared will be the Translation Table file CallElement with the
00385  * GenotypeTableModel (CHP) CallElement.
00386  *
00387  * @param ce1 - the CallElement to compare
00388  *
00389  * @return true - if equal.
00390  */
00391 /*****************************************************************************/
00392 bool CallElement::operator==(CallElement const & ce1) const
00393 {
00394 
00395 
00396   if (m_probeSet != ce1.m_probeSet)  return false;
00397 
00398   for (int i = 0; i < m_bases.size(); i++) {
00399 
00400     if (isWildCardBase(m_bases[i]))     return true;
00401 
00402     for (int j = 0; j < ce1.m_bases.size(); j++) {
00403 
00404       if (isWildCardBase(ce1.m_bases[j])) return true;
00405 
00406       if (m_bases[i] == ce1.m_bases[j])  {
00407         return true;
00408       }
00409 
00410     }
00411 
00412   }
00413 
00414   return false;
00415 
00416 }
00417 // end CallElement::operator==
00418 /*****************************************************************************/
00419 /*****************************************************************************/
00420 /**
00421  * CallElement::reverseComplement
00422  *
00423  * Synopsis:
00424  *
00425  *   Switch to the other strand by taking the reverse complement.
00426  *
00427  * @param seq - the base (allele) sequence to take the complement of.
00428  *
00429  * @return rev - the reverse complement
00430  */
00431 /*****************************************************************************/
00432 std::string CallElement::reverseComplement(const std::string seq)
00433 {
00434 
00435   std::string rev;
00436 
00437   rev.clear();
00438 
00439   if (CallElement::isWildCardBase(seq)) {
00440     return seq;
00441   }
00442 
00443   for (int i = seq.size() - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
00444     switch (seq[i]) {
00445     case '-':
00446       rev.append("-");
00447       break;
00448     case 'a':
00449       rev.append("t");
00450       break;
00451     case 'c':
00452       rev.append("g");
00453       break;
00454     case 'g':
00455       rev.append("c");
00456       break;
00457     case 't':
00458       rev.append("a");
00459       break;
00460     case 'A':
00461       rev.append("T");
00462       break;
00463     case 'C':
00464       rev.append("G");
00465       break;
00466     case 'G':
00467       rev.append("C");
00468       break;
00469     case 'T':
00470       rev.append("A");
00471       break;
00472     case '0':   // Copy Number 0
00473       rev.append("0");
00474       break;
00475     default:
00476       std::string temp(seq[i], 1);
00477       rev.append(temp);
00478     }
00479   }
00480   return rev;
00481 
00482 }
00483 // end CallElement::reverseComplement
